metadata.title: CVE-2017-16644 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
The hdpvr_probe function in drivers/media/usb/hdpvr/hdpvr-core.c in theLinux kernel through 4.13.11 allows local users to cause a denial ofservice (improper error handling and system crash) or possibly haveunspecified other impact via a crafted USB device.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16644` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-lowlatency - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-snapdragon - 5.4.0-9.12
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1004-raspi2 - 5.4.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1005-aws - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1033-gke - 5.4.0-1033.35
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-5.8.0-23-generic - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1

linux-image-unsigned-5.8.0-23-generic - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.8.0-23-generic-64k - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.8.0-23-lowlatency - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
No subscription required
